result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

STC of cases discussed.  Per Atty Brewer, working on cases.  10/27 at 1:15 for PTC.  Parties to contact immediately after PTC to schedule.  Bond continues.  Adj.  10:55 a.m.  klr

records.addlTxt: Pre-trial conference on May 19, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

09:19 AM BACK ON RECORD IN CASES.  Defendant Marshall Wayne Allen in court.  Matthew J Tingstad appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Heidi E. Brewer appeared by video means for Defendant Marshall Wayne Allen.  Court calls cases, cites appearances.  Atty Brewer has gone through complaints.  Def waives reading.  ATty reserves all jurisd. challenges.  In Misd charges, mute, in felony charges, def waive time limits only for prelim.  22CF8, def preserves PL but waives TL.  PTC to be set for May 19th at 1:30 p.m.  22CT4, mids. charges, def stands mute.  Court to enter NG.  PTC on May 19th at 1:30 p.m.  22CF13, def preserves right to PL but waives TL.  PTC on May 19 at 1:30 p.m.  Adj.  9:23 p.m.  klr

09:04 AM Attorney Heidi E. Brewer appeared by video means for Defendant Marshall Wayne Allen. Prosecuting Atty Matthew J Tingstad appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Court calls case.  Def FTA. records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
BACK ON RECORD AT 10:10 AM Defendant Marshall Wayne Allen in court.  Matthew J Tingstad appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court calls case.  Court notes that PD has notified court that he is eligible but have not appointed anyone yet.  Court continues IAs and STCs to allow atty time to go over with client.  On 22CT4, Court addressing bond today.  $400 was posted to be released from SD.  DA is satisfied with signature bond of $1,000.  Bond refunded to poster.  Conditions are:  Def not drive while revoked.  Explained to def.  No questions.  4/11 at 9:00 for all cases.  Adj.  10:15 a.m.  klr

10:04 a.m.  Court refers to all cases.  DA indicates not contact made by def.  DA requests warrant with condition that def can be released upon posting $1,000 cash and to appear the following Monday.  Court grants warrant but to avoid confusion, is only authorizing in 22CF8.  Adj.  10:05 a.m.  klr
Def shall not possess or use alcohol or controlled substances.  Def shall have no contact with S.V. (known to defendant)

10:48 AM Defendant Marshall Wayne Allen in court, in custody.  Matthew J Tingstad appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court calls case, cites appearances.  Vic appears via phone.  Def identifies himself.  Public def info given with copy of complaint.  Court explains rt to atty and process to obtain.  Court goes through charges/penalties.  Def understands.  Def indicates will have atty.  No questions about proceeding.  $1,000 cash bond requested with provision of no contact with S.V. requested by DA.  Court asks def's position on bail.  Def indicates he does not have cash.  Lives in Ironwood.  Vic does not take a position on bond but does want no contact provision.  Def has no objection to no contact provision.  Court reviews older cases.  Court sets bond as requested.  No contact with victim.  No possession or use of alc or controlled substances.  No questions from def.  Initial App on 3/14 at 10:00 a.m.  Warrant served/quashed.  Adj.  10:58 a.m.
